text.section: An order of the Commission shall take effect within a reasonable time that the Commission prescribes, and shall continue in force according to the terms of the order unless vacated, suspended, modified, or superseded by further order of the Commission or by a court of competent jurisdiction.

section.section: A person served with an order of the Commission shall promptly notify the Commission in writing of receipt of service.
For notification by a corporation under paragraph (1) of this subsection, a person authorized to accept service for the corporation shall sign the notice.

The Commission may require in an order that notice be provided to the Commission:
within the time specified in the order;
in the same manner as notice provided in paragraph (1) of this subsection; and
describing if, and to what extent, the order is accepted and will be obeyed.
An order of a panel constituted under § 3-104(a) of this subtitle is final.

A proposed order of a commissioner or hearing examiner under § 3-104(d) of this subtitle becomes final unless a party to the proceeding notes an appeal with the Commission within the time period for appeal designated in the proposed order.
The time period for appeal designated in the proposed order is 30 days unless the order specifies a shorter period of at least 7 days.

On appeal, the Commission promptly shall:
consider the matter on the record before the commissioner or hearing examiner;
conduct any further proceedings that it considers necessary including requiring the filing of briefs and the holding of oral argument; and
issue a final order.

text.section: Notwithstanding the Administrative Procedure Act, unless a provision of this article specifically requires the Commission to act through regulation, the Commission may implement any provision of this article by either order or regulation as the Commission deems necessary and proper.
